channel.title: Comments on: Creating Mailing Labels in SQL Server Reporting Services
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description:
To quote George Eliot, "It's never too late to be what you might have been."
I'm glad you found this useful! Thank you for letting me know.
item.content:encoded:
To quote George Eliot, “It’s never too late to be what you might have been.”

I’m glad you found this useful! Thank you for letting me know.

item.title: By: AmyD
item.dc:creator: AmyD
item.description:
I have to pull some data for mailing in health care. I created the whole letter with the contact on for window envelopes. I'm so happy to see this as well. This will save so much in manhours. The expression was a little hairy. I don't have a degree or an impressive resume but I sure do love this stuff. Only took me until I was 40 yo to find that out.
Thanks for your time with this!
item.content:encoded:
I have to pull some data for mailing in health care. I created the whole letter with the contact on for window envelopes. I’m so happy to see this as well. This will save so much in manhours. The expression was a little hairy. I don’t have a degree or an impressive resume but I sure do love this stuff. Only took me until I was 40 yo to find that out.

Thanks for your time with this!

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Check the number of columns - step 2A. Other than that, maybe adjust margins and padding to make sure they don't add up to more than the width and height of your sheet.
item.content:encoded: Check the number of columns – step 2A. Other than that, maybe adjust margins and padding to make sure they don’t add up to more than the width and height of your sheet.

item.title: By: Ashley H.
item.dc:creator: Ashley H.
item.description: I have my labels printing in two columns, but I can't seem to get it to go to the next row. It prints two columns, then does two more columns at the top of the next page. What should I check to help it to print on the next row? I should see five rows per page, two columns, for a total of 10 labels per sheet. Any suggestions appreciated :)
item.content:encoded: I have my labels printing in two columns, but I can’t seem to get it to go to the next row. It prints two columns, then does two more columns at the top of the next page. What should I check to help it to print on the next row? I should see five rows per page, two columns, for a total of 10 labels per sheet. Any suggestions appreciated ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Pratik
item.dc:creator: Pratik
item.description: Sorry I figured this out. I was adding list from the toolbox which is different then list, right click and list worked. Thanks again for wonderful article.
item.content:encoded: Sorry I figured this out. I was adding list from the toolbox which is different then list, right click and list worked. Thanks again for wonderful article.

item.title: By: Pratik
item.dc:creator: Pratik
item.content:encoded:
First of all Thanks for this wonderful article, I followed your steps but I just get only one client’s name on top left corner not full sheet, however when I run my query it give me top 30 clients from my table for specific site. Here is my query
Select top 30 –distinct
fa.new_sitename as Office,
fa.new_clientidname as Client,
fa.new_servicename,
fa.new_clientdateofbirth as DOB

from Filterednew_admission fa
where
fa.new_sitename= ‘Office-London’

Am I missing anything.

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: It's been years since I worked with this, so my memory may be unclear. When you deploy to Report Manager, you have to Export to PDF. Then you can print it. See my comment above to Greg.
item.content:encoded: It’s been years since I worked with this, so my memory may be unclear. When you deploy to Report Manager, you have to Export to PDF. Then you can print it. See my comment above to Greg.

item.title: By: Vinod
item.dc:creator: Vinod
item.description: How this solution works further? i.e., if the report is deployed and opened using Report Server or Manager. Once opened in Report Manager, how to open or export using Print layout button (as I see there is no option)?
item.content:encoded: How this solution works further? i.e., if the report is deployed and opened using Report Server or Manager. Once opened in Report Manager, how to open or export using Print layout button (as I see there is no option)?

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: JC, there's no default setting for that. You'd have to do some crazy T-SQL to UNION the records.
item.content:encoded: JC, there’s no default setting for that. You’d have to do some crazy T-SQL to UNION the records.
